page.title: 08Religion in Dunnington
page.content: The{Dunnington parish church,}St. Nicholas dates from Norman times. Services are held every Sunday at 8.00 am, 9.15 am, 10.45 am and 6.30 pm. There are usally about 50 to 80 people at a service. The rector lives in the rectory next door,and holds a Church Fete in his garden in June and for the last few years has organised a pantomime at Christmas. The{Methodist Chapel}is 100 years old and has about 50 people,including Sunday School children, at morning service. The{church and chapel}have a lively joint youth club, a joint magazine and hold some services together. {Murton Church}is a branch of the Murton-cum-Osbaldwick parish and has evensong fornightly and communion weekly.
